item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 5 Balance Changes—All Buffs & Nerfs
item.content:encoded:
A new season is deploying in Marvel Rivals with the launch of Season 5, which naturally comes alongside a fresh balance patch with buffs and nerfs, and we’ve got all the details.

Season 5 in Marvel Rivals features all the tweaks we’ve come to expect with the seasonal transition of the title, including a shake-up to Team-Up Abilities, and tweaks are made to specific heroes to ensure they all remain viable.

For a breakdown of all the buffs and nerfs present in Marvel Rivals for the Season 5 launch, we’ve got all the information you need.

All Marvel Rivals Season 5 Buffs & Nerfs

Season 5 sees potentially the biggest balance changes of all, and remarkably, there’s not a single nerf at launch. Instead, a host of characters are receiving buffs.

For Vanguards, stand-out changes include Peni Parker’s Cuber-Webs now providing the same Healing Over Time and Movement Boost to ally players as she receives, while Magneto’s Metal Bulwark and Iron Bulwark have had their cooldowns seperated, although the shield value is reduced from 250 to 200.

In the DPS scene, Mister Fantastic’s Bonus Health has been tweaked to provide an addition of 350 Maximum Health and a one-time heal of 350, which is removed upon exiting his inflated state, while Squirrel Girl’s Burst Acorn damage has been increased to 110 from 100.

Finally, two Strategists have seen their base health increased, with Cloak & Dagger and Loki receiving the boost, while Invisible Woman can now deploy a shield in front of her.

Here’s a full list of all the characters affected with buffs and nerfs in Season 5.

Buffs

  • Angela
  • Peni Parker
  • Magneto
  • Captain America
  • Groot
  • Hulk
  • The Thing
  • Hawkeye
  • Phoenix
  • Mister Fantastic
  • Storm
  • Spider-Man
  • The Punisher
  • Wolverine
  • Adam Warlock
  • Cloak & Dagger
  • Invisible Woman
  • Loki
  • Rocket Raccoon

Nerfs

  • None

Full Marvel Rivals Version 20251114 Season 5 Balance Post Patch Notes

Take a look at the full details of the latest balance patch below, as shared on the official Marvel Rivals website.

Angela

The Hand of Heven sharpens her edge, bringing even (slightly) greater threat to the battlefield.
– Increase Movement Speed of Assassin’s Charge accelerated dash state from 16m/s to 18m/s.
– Increase Heven’s Retribution (Ultimate Ability) spear Health from 600 to 800.

Captain America

Steve Rogers steps up as the ultimate team player!
– Freedom Charge (Ultimate Ability) New Effect: Allies within its path gain a 30% boost to Ultimate Energy charge efficiency.

Groot

The gentle giant gets tougher!
– Ironwood Wall New Effect: Gain Unstoppable status when within 15m of Awakened Ironwood Walls.

Hulk

The Green Goliath’s protection game goes gamma!
– Gamma Burst New Effect: Each direct hit reduces Indestructible Guard cooldown by 1s.

Magneto

Max amplifies his shielding frequency for both self and allies.
– Separate the cooldowns of Metal Bulwark and Iron Bulwark. Now, activating one won’t send the other on cooldown.
– Reduce Metal Bulwark and Iron Bulwark shield value from 250 to 200.

Peni Parker

SP//dr’s pilot takes teamwork to the next level!
– Allies in Peni’s Cyber-Webs now receive the same Healing Over Time and a Movement Boost effects as her. Movement Boost for allies is 25%, Healing is 15/s. Ally excess healing converts into Bonus Health, up to 25.

The Thing

Ben Grimm doubles down on defense and offense.
– Embattled Leap: Remove Damage Reduction from single leap target, now grants 20% Damage Reduction to all allies within 5m of his landing point. Reduce Damage Reduction to self from 25% to 20%.
– Battle Blitz: Remove Damage Reduction from self. Now applies 20% Vulnerability to all enemies within 5m of his landing point.
– Reduce Stone Haymaker base Damage from 90 to 55 and remove 50 Bonus Health gained during ability activation. New Effects: Deal bonus Damage equal to 8% of enemies’ max Health per hit. Gain Bonus Health equal to damage dealt (up to 100).

DUELIST

Hawkeye

Clint’s precision packs a slightly bigger punch!
– Increase Archer’s Focus maximum Bonus Damage from 75 to 90.

Mister Fantastic

Reed Richards gets even stretchier and tougher.
– Reflexive Rubber can now be used during Inflated state after reaching 100 Elasticity.
– Remove the 350 Bonus Health on entering Inflated state; now gain 350 Maximum Health and a one-time heal of 350, which is removed upon exiting the Inflated state.

Phoenix

Jean Grey’s cosmic fire burns brighter:
– Adjust Cosmic Flames maximum falloff at 30m from 60% to 75%.

Spider-Man

Peter Parker’s web-slinging offense gets a slight lift.
– Reduce Web-Cluster energize time from 2.5s to 2s.
– Increase Amazing Combo Damage from 60 to 70.

Squirrel Girl

Doreen’s nutty offense gets a boost.
– Increase Burst Acorn Damage from 100 to 110.

Storm

Ororo empowers her allies with even greater force.
– Increase Weather Control – Thunder’s Damage Boost to allies from 10% to 12%.
– Increase Goddess Boost – Thunder’s Damage Boost to allies from 12% to 15%.

The Punisher

Frank Castle loses his Team-Up Anchor bonus, but gains raw power.
– Increase base health from 275 to 300.
– Adjust Adjudication maximum falloff at 40m from 70% to 85%.
– Increase pellets fired per Deliverance round from 14 to 16.

Wolverine

Logan’s claws get deadlier, especially against Vanguards.
– Increase Savage Claw’s Percentage Damage for each point of Rage from 0.045% to 0.057%.
– Increase Vicious Rampage’s Percentage Damage for each point of Rage from 0.045% to 0.057%.
– Reduce Feral Leap cooldown from 15s to 12s.

STRATEGIST

Adam Warlock

Adam’s cosmic control and ultimate impact are enhanced.
– Increase soul flight speed from 6m/s to 12m/s.
– Reduce Karmic Revival (Ultimate Ability) Energy cost from 4700 to 4500 and increase ally detection radius from 30m to 35m.

Cloak & Dagger

The dynamic duo’s durability increases.
– Increase base health from 250 to 275.

Invisible Woman

Susan Storm’s power and survivability are up.
– Increase Orb Projection hit damage from 25 to 30; projectile maximum range from 30m to 35m, and projectile speed from 120m/s to 150m/s.
– Increase Force Physics length from 30m to 35m.
– Guardian Shield New Effect: If no Guardian Shield is present, pressing the recall key now deploys a shield in front of Invisible Woman.

Loki

The Trickster God gets trickier and tougher.
– Increase base health from 250 to 275.
– Adjust Mystical Missile’s damage falloff at 3m from 50% to 80%. New Effect: Now heals directly hit allies for an extra 10 Health.

Rocket Raccoon

Rocket’s support and firepower are slightly tuned up.
– Reduce B.R.B. cooldown from 45s to 40s.
– Increase Repair Mode maximum count from 5 to 7 and projectile speed from 60m/s to 80m/s.
– Increase Bombard Mode Projectile Speed from 150m/s to 180m/s.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 5 Roadmap Reveals Date For Rogue Release
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals is set to switch over into a new season with the launch of Season 5, with two new characters joining the battlefield, and the roadmap for the season has revealed when Rogue will be playable.

Rogue is one of two new additions to the Marvel Rivals character roster in Season 5, alongside her partner, Gambit. However, while Remy LeBeau will be available from the start of Season 5 on November 14, players will have to wait a little bit longer for Rogue’s arrival.

Rogue Joins Marvel Rivals on December 12

NetEase has shared an official roadmap for the content coming in Season 5, which reveals the release date for several new costumes, the start of the Anniversary Event, where players can earn up to $25 worth of currency for free, and the launch of the 18-vs-18 Conquest Annihilation game mode.

However, the biggest news of all confirms just how long the first half of the season will last, as it’s revealed that Season 5.5 will begin on December 12.

We don’t yet know all of the content that will be launching at the start of Season 5.5, but we do know the mid-point in the season will mark the arrival of Rogue.

Given the time of the year Season 5.5 launches, it’s expected that a Holiday Event to cover Christmas and the New Year will be on the cards at some point, while Season 6 will launch in January 2026.

item.title: ‘Several’ Tier 1 Counter-Strike 2 Events Won’t Happen in 2026, It’s Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
In a recent post on social media, the CEO of PGL, Silviu Stroie, confirmed that ‘several’ high-tier Counter-Strike 2 tournaments won’t take place in 2026. This is because an announcement pathway wasn’t followed, which unfortunately violates Valve’s tournament operation requirements.

The post on social media confirmed that none of the Starladder events in 2026 will take place, and two of the three Fissure events in 2026 have also been struck from the schedule.

CS2 Events Slashed From the Schedule

The post from Silviu Stroie, CEO of PGL, reads:

Several CS2 Tier 1 events in 2026 won’t take place, as they missed the deadline for announcing the additional details. None of the Starladder CS2 Tier 1 events in 2026 will take place. The same applies to two of the three Fissure CS2 Tier 1 events in 2026 (Playground 4 and Playground 5). So far, there has been no Starladder announcement for any Tier 1 event in 2027.

In one of the most important comments under the post, a user wrote, ‘How can this happen? Like, if you know that this is a requirement, there’s like a 0% chance of missing the deadline if it’s your main business.’

Valve’s tournament operation requirements demand that organizers provide ‘additional information’ within a certain timeframe after an initial announcement. That deadline was missed by some, and therefore, these tournaments will not be allowed to go ahead.

Neither of the organizers impacted by this confirmation have provided a statement to say what’s happening, but Stroie also mentioned that no Starladder events have been announced (at Tier 1) going into 2027, which is cryptic to say the least. This was later refuted by Starladder, as the company revealed that ‘the next Tier-1 Starladder event comes in October 2027’.

item.title: Escape from Tarkov Twitch Drops Campaign Confirmed for Launch
item.content:encoded:
This weekend, Escape from Tarkov hits a 1.0 state after a decade in testing and development. It’s a monumental time to be a fan of the spearhead extraction shooter, and the release comes as the genre is experiencing something of a boom, spurred onwards by the recent arrival of ARC Raiders.

Battlestate Games confirmed that Escape from Tarkov will have a new Twitch Drops campaign that’s kicking off to celebrate the launch of the game on November 15, this coming Saturday.

Tarkov Twitch Drops Coming

From November 15 to December 6, Tarkov fans will be able to watch their favorite streamers exploring the new 1.0 update that brings the game into an entirely new world. The drops will reward players with different reward crates, containing some loot that could be considered highly exclusive:

  • Hideout Targets
  • Tarko Figuring
  • Nikita’s PMC Voice

There’s a split between the rewards coming to the Escape from Tarkov Twitch Drops campaign, and that’s between free and paid-for rewards. If you dish out subscriptions during the event, you’ll unlock even more content in Escape from Tarkov:

  • 5 Subs – Cap, M-2 Brown & Secure Container
  • 3 Subs – PMC Dogtag (Twitch)
  • 1 Sub – Hideout Decor

It was stressed that the split is timed differently, too. The free drops run until November 28, while the paid rewards will stay live until December 6.

More content will be added, per a graphic published by Battlestate Games, so expect plenty of rewards to flow going into Escape from Tarkov’s 1.0 release – provided you watch those streaming the game. The 1.0 update is highly anticipated and will bring a new map, story, and many other quality-of-life improvements and upgrades.

item.title: ARC Raiders North Line Update Release Time—Stella Montis Unlock
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders has a new supersized update inbound called North Line, and it introduces a new map, new ARC enemies, weapons, quests, and more. It will be made accessible via a community event that requires all users to contribute to a project to bust open a tunnel leading to the new map, Stella Montis.

Many are wondering when the North Line update will be released. It’s coming out today, but the release time for the update isn’t clear. Read on to learn what we know about the ARC Raiders North Line update release times.

When is North Line Releasing on ARC Raiders?

The North Line update for ARC Raiders will be released today, November 13, at 09:30 AM GMT / 04:30 AM ET / 01:30 AM PT. This timing convention is to allow for a unified launch of the update across all platforms and territories.

Fans of the post-apocalyptic extraction shooter will be able to enjoy some of the trappings of the North Line update when it drops, but the bulk of it will come after the Breaking New Ground event has been completed.

This is where players must contribute Metal Parts, Fabric, Chemicals, Plastic Parts, and Rubber Parts to the centralized project to open up the tunnels to Stella Montis. Here, players will be able to explore a new path in ‘Staking Our Claim’, digging deep into Stella Montis, facing new ARC threats, and preparing for the next major ARC Raiders update – Cold Snap.

There’s a busy roadmap ahead, and Embark Studios has promised to support ARC Raiders for the next decade, so expect plenty more maps, modes, weapons, and more to be added in the coming months to make way for that lifecycle.

item.title: Escape from Tarkov’s PvE Platform Might Have a Drastic Change Coming
item.content:encoded:
Escape from Tarkov is finally being ‘released’ this week after a decade in alpha and beta stages. It brings an end to years of development that have culminated in Escape from Tarkov being the most popular extraction shooter ever made. It’s a paradigm shift of a title that’s evolving into a 1.0 state this coming Saturday.

In a recent interview, the head of the studio at Battlestate Games, Nikita Buyanov, suggested that a drastic balancing mechanic might be put into play for Escape from Tarkov’s PvE platform.

They Might Wipe the PvE Flea Market

Nikita suggested in a recent interview with Pestily that the team at Battlestate Games might wipe the Flea Market specifically on the PvE platform when 1.0 drops. Pestily addressed the Flea Market being ‘filled with stuff’ that PvE players have collected over many months, impacting the mode’s economy.

Nikita said:

We will see. Maybe we will wipe the Flea Market, for example.

Nobody said that we can’t do that. We can wipe the Flea Market, and nobody will say anything to us, because the Flea Market is just a sub-system that we can wipe.


Escape from Tarkov players focused on PvE will need to wipe their accounts to access the new story being introduced with 1.0. This story will finally allow players to escape from Tarkov, presenting them with a branching campaign with multiple endings.

This is bad news for the PvE players (like myself) who have spent the last year racking up a phenomenal stash and building the strongest character they’ve ever made, simply because PvE doesn’t automatically wipe.

The economy that has been created because of that is a little skewed, so pushing for a reset of this kind might be a neat balancing tactic.
